title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 June 2016 - XWiki
content: has quit 02:07  has joined #xwiki 02:47  has quit 03:18  has joined #xwiki 05:17  has quit 06:41  has joined #xwiki 08:05  has quit 08:21  has quit 08:29  has joined #xwiki 08:33  has joined #xwiki 08:46  has joined #xwiki 09:04  has joined #xwiki 09:15  has joined #xwiki 09:17  has quit 09:30  has quit 09:30  has joined #xwiki 09:44  good morning everyone 09:44  morning 09:53  tmortagne: good morning, hope you had a good we. I have a question for you on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/MARKDOWN-9?focusedCommentId=91832&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-91832 (I'm trying to debug my markdown issue) 09:54  maybe you know the reason? 09:54  (I can explain by voice if need be :)) 09:56  vmassol: no idea, never really looked much at URIClassLoader details, would need to debug all that 09:56  but I really doubt find class don't look at parent as otherwise nothing would work I think 09:56  that's what i don't fully understand 09:57  but when I try it step by step in the debugger that's what it does 10:00  ok, I would like to finish with markdown links and image this morning and I can look at it this afternoon 10:00  s/markdown/mediawiki ? :) 10:00  ok we can talk this afternoon 10:00  thanks 10:07  has joined #xwiki 10:07  has joined #xwiki 10:09  yes mediawiki 10:10  @All: do you know if we support path-based for REST or if we need to have the subwiki in the domain? 10:11  for example in xwiki.properties we have: 10:11  # extension.repositories=extensions.xwiki.org:xwiki:http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/rest/ 10:11  how would we write that extensions.xwiki.org URL in path-based? 10:12  there is no path based support REST module level 10:13  ok that's what I thought, thanks 10:38  has joined #xwiki 10:53  has joined #xwiki 11:29  has quit 11:30  has joined #xwiki 12:38  has joined #xwiki 12:59  has quit 13:00  has joined #xwiki 13:29  has quit 13:30  has joined #xwiki 14:15  has quit 14:18  has quit 14:18  has joined #xwiki 14:29  has quit 14:30  has quit 14:49  has quit 14:56  has quit 14:56  has joined #xwiki 14:57  has quit 14:59  has quit 14:59  has joined #xwiki 14:59  has joined #xwiki 15:00  has joined #xwiki 15:09  has joined #xwiki 15:57  has joined #xwiki 15:57  has joined #xwiki 15:57  has joined #xwiki 15:57  has joined #xwiki 15:57  has joined #xwiki 15:57  has joined #xwiki 16:29  has quit 16:29  has quit 16:47  has quit 17:09  has joined #xwiki 17:10  hello 17:11  I hope everybody is good since last time I showed here :) 17:11  I have a question related to the class sheet custom display 17:11  probably; at least everyone is somewhat busy ;) 17:12  haha 17:12  look like 17:12  I will write the question and hope maybe somone have the answer and the time to give it 17:13  I found this page about custom display but it lake some info .. (or I am the one missing some knowledge) 17:13  http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/Bindings+available+inside+the+Custom+Display+property#History 17:14  so it helped me but when you want to change for example colors of the values selected by the user, how do you get the value ? 17:14  $value is the value 17:14  of the property 17:14  for example I have this list of values : value1=Libre|value2=Occupé par ...etc 17:15  what I manage to get is "value1" .. but I want to show "Libre" 17:15  the real value and not it's id 17:15  not sure if I'm explaining it right ? 17:16  I guess you have to go through the class 17:16  and yes I used "$value" but here it give me value1 or value2 .. not what I need :s 17:16  $MyClass=$object.getxWikiClass() 17:16  then getProperty(...) 17:17  basically get the definition and extract the pretty name using the id 17:17  hm, in the example it does only use $listitem for the items in the options 17:17  you need somehow to call PropertyClass#getMapValues() 17:19  so I use something like  : #set($MyClass=$object.getxwikiClass() then #set($Property=$MyClass.getProperty('nameoftheproperty') 17:19  so  $MyClass.getMapValues().get($listitem)  should work to get the "displayName" ? 17:19  the "displayName" is the prettyname ? 17:20  yes, yes, that is what I meant 17:20  darn, I cannot remember the last time I did this .... 17:21  here: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Display+Static+List+Elements 17:21  I'm afraid I'm not very good at java code (or any code for what's matter ^^v) 17:22  ok checking this link 17:23  this code let me use the "$value" to get the real displayname/prettyname then ? 17:23  I need to put it at the beggining of my velocity code and it would work if I understand it right ? 17:24  the code is an example to display all values (in view mode, so to say) 17:25  so my code snippet to replace $listitem as visible text inside the < option > tag on that page  http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/Bindings+available+inside+the+Custom+Display+property 17:26  was even nearly correct, it should just have been:   $MyClass.getMapValues().get($listitem).getValue() 17:27  ah you are the author of this page ? 17:27  no 17:27  I admit I havn't understood all your code .. not my "level" :s 17:27  that is Pbas 17:28  basically I only want to show the values on the page in different colors, depending on the value shown 17:28  well, but you can see that the code displays a select box filled with options ...  ah, 17:28  so you only want to change the view mode ? 17:28  so if the value is "free", it's shown in green whenyou check it in view mode .. or red if it's "busy" .. and so on .. no need for change in edit mode of course. 17:29  and yes , only in view mode 17:29  has quit 17:29  has left #xwiki 17:29  then indeed vmassol's link of http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Display+Static+List+Elements  is a better starting point 17:29  I started the script with : if ($type == "view") 17:29  has joined #xwiki 17:29  and "red" and "green" are the "prettyPrint" values ? 17:30  yes 17:30  with something like : 17:30    #if ($value != "Libre") 17:30      {{html clean = "false"}} 17:30        $value 17:30      {{/html}} 17:30  etc.. 17:31  well, the $value is indeed the current value, and you want something like #set($prettyName = $MyClass.getMapValues().get($value).getValue()) 17:31  I wanted to have some different colorset for each static list (there are 6 or 7) 17:32  and then < span style="color: $prettyName">$value   or such 17:32  so I looked at the custom display instead of changing the sheet 17:32  $MyClass as above in the code 17:33  ok 17:33  so I set the "prettyname" first 17:34  then call it with the $value .. I will try that, thank you 17:34  I hope it works :) 17:35  me too 17:35  I guess you will also need a #if ($type = 'edit')  branch, or the value is no longer editable ... 17:35  do I need to change something like an #elseif (blablabla) for the edition mode ? 17:35  ah 17:35  yes, we are in synch :) 17:35  lol you just answered me before I asked the question 17:36  what should I write in the edit branch ? I'm even more lost for this side of the code :s 17:36  I think you can copy the part between the #if and the first #elseif from http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/Bindings+available+inside+the+Custom+Display+property  for that 17:37  unfortunately one cannot call the "build-in" edit display in cases like this 17:37  too bad 17:37  so you have to "rewrite" everything in the edit mode ? 17:38  yes, as far as I know 17:38  aww ok 17:40  ok trying with what you offered me here .. I'll be back :) 17:41  like Schwarzenegger in Terminator =:-? 17:43  yeah firing lot of questionbullet :p 17:54  I think I'm progressing, now I have the colors ^^ but I think I'm not calling prettyName the right way 17:55  I used it like that :       $value 17:57  your not using css correctly 17:57  you need to replace $value with $prettyName 17:57  (and display means something else in css) 17:59  ok 17:59  and yes I don't know very well the css, you're right 18:04  ah, I though the color is the prettyName in this use case here, but maybe I am the confused one ;) 18:05  I don't know what you want to do :) 18:05  here you're display a text in red 18:05  \*displaying 18:05  in any case I think it is either $value   or $prettyName 18:05  to be precise: you're displaying the technical id in red 18:10  ok 18:12  so I have static list, with 17 values, presented like that : value1=Libre|value2=Occupé par A|value3=Occupé par B|value4=Occupé par C|value5=Occupé par D|value6=Occupé par .... and so on 18:13  I want for example that if the value1 is selected, then it will be displayed in green on the "view" .. but if it's another value (C,D,E ....) it will be displayed in red 18:13  so I will either display "Libre" in green or "Occupé par xx" in red, in view mode only 18:13  no change needed in edit mode (it's perfect) 18:14  ah, ok, but then where to you have the color values ? I mean the mapping of ids to the color values? 18:14  xwiki\_finstern: could I ask you your name? (I like to know who I'm talking too and match it with email that people send on the lists - you probably have sent some mails there I guess ;)) 18:14  so yes, as for now, I managed to display the technical id, in green or red 18:14  the $prettyName is actually text ... 18:14  not already vmassol, but it's emmanuel klein :) 18:15  well, you can do e.g. $prettyName  to display the pretty name in red 18:15  nice to meet you Emmanuel :) 18:16  until now I have read lot of faq pages and researched in the dev guide and read some guides about velocity at oracle website .. 18:16  and so on 18:17  sorry to ask stupid questions, I'm not an experienced developper :) 18:17  for velocity I have bookmarked this page, btw:  http://velocity.apache.org/engine/devel/user-guide.html 18:17  Clemens, I tried that, I assumed at first that would work 18:17  of course everything is red then, as it is hard wired 18:18  tmortagne: 18:18  and all: 18:18  so the question is: how do you decide which values are green and which are red ? 18:18  seems we cannot search anymore locally on dev.xwiki.org 18:18  in fact Clemens I get a $prettyName in red 18:18  :D 18:19  hmm I don't remember but maybe it's "normal" 18:19  (I mean, the text is really "$prettyName") 18:19  even with #set($prettyName = $MyClass.getMapValues().get($value).getValue())   ? 18:19  vmassol: you mean it's not expected that search goes to main wiki ? I tough it was 18:19  yes but 18:19  you can search on main wiki and then filter only dev wiki results 18:19  there's no auto suggest and the search seems to be the DB one 18:19  on main wiki ? 18:19  it is like that for quite some time, the search, I mean 18:19  I get redirected to http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Search?text=&f\_type=DOCUMENT&f\_locale=en&f\_locale=&r=1 18:20  I have this code currently (above is the custom display code for edit mode) : 18:20  #elseif ($type == "view") 18:20  hmm no it's ok acutually 18:20  once I enter a search term I get the solr result 18:20  yes looks like solr to me 18:20    #set ($prettyName = $MyClass.getMapValues().get($value).getValue()) 18:20    #if ($value != 'value1') 18:20  I see drilldown in the search in the main wiki,so its the solr search 18:20  I was expecting solr without entering anyting 18:20  solr ui that is 18:20      {{html clean = "false"}} 18:21        $prettyName 18:21  etc.. 18:21  vmassol: that's because you are used to end up on this page with a search input already passed :) 18:21  hm, ok, but $prettyName is not set? 18:21  narf, then the '#set' command does not work as I thought it does 18:22  [18:18] <+ClemensR> so the question is: how do you decide which values are green and which are red ? : with this : #if ($value != 'value1') 18:22  yes, I see, ok 18:23  and I added   #set ($prettyName = $MyClass.getMapValues().get($value).getValue()) 18:23  just before the "#if" 18:23  so it should work, except that  $prettyName is not set 18:23  tmortagne: yeah 18:23  xwiki\_finstern: do you have a #set($MyClass=$object.getxWikiClass()), too? 18:24  it is but in the 'edit' part .. 18:24  I will add it thank for the idea 18:26  no change 18:27  it does not work locally for me either ... tsts I should always check things first before parting code elsewhere 18:28  ah, I think I see ... gimem a minute 18:29  of course 18:30  xwiki\_finstern: you should buy a beer to ClemensR one day ;) lol 18:30  I should yes 18:31  its just a problem that I cannot write UI code for XWiki either ;) 18:31  he helped me a lot 18:32  well, first it is definitely    #set($prettyName = $MyClass.get($name).getMapValues().get($value)) 18:32  I forgot the .get($name). in the middle of that 18:32  but then $prettyName  is a list instead of a string 18:33  ah, it returns a com.xpn.xwiki.objects.classes.ListItem ... 18:34  no ".getValue()" at the end Clemens ? 18:34  yes ! 18:34  I mwan 18:34  mean 18:34  that was my mistake 18:34  there must be a "getValue()" at the end 18:34  #set($prettyName = $MyClass.get($name).getMapValues().get($value).getValue()) 18:35  is the right incantation, and suddenly it works 18:35  ahaaa 18:35  so I missed the get($name) .. ok testing 18:37  still not working for me :-| 18:37  what was this code sharing site .. 18:37  gist? pastebin? 18:38  pastebin 18:38  thank you vincent 18:38  I couldn't remember the name 18:40  ok 18:40  here is the code 18:40  http://pastebin.com/hCszxLZV 18:41  getValue() insted of getvalue() 18:41  upper/lowercase is relevant ehere 18:41  (in line 26) 18:42  oh god ! 18:43  thank you 18:43  now it work 18:44  wow .. it work .. now I have to rework the edit code so that it look nice again in edit mode and I'm done 18:44  thank you very much, you helped me a lot, I owe you 18:45  phew, finally 18:45  I gotta go soon, so this was a close call ;) 18:46  in editmode I think you can use the same trick 18:46  at #foreach($listitem in $list) 18:46  I'm looking for it yeah 18:46  add an #($prettyName = $MyClass.get($name).getMapValues().get($listitem)) 18:47  and use that below in #set ($MySelectList=$MySelectList + "") 18:47  or so ... assuming the current edit view works, actually ;) 18:47  it work 18:48  just distorted and there is a .. Space.DocWith\_XWiki.TranslationDocumentClass\_Object.Empty in the list 18:48  I will get it back in shape when I manage to debug this little one, I will apply your suggestion above and see what happen 18:49  thank you very much Clemens, if you happen to live in Paris, I will offer a beer or something if you want :) 18:52  this it the value to be shown if nothing is selected. you can replace it by a '--' or whatever you like, or maybe even omit it 18:53  well, I will remind you if I come to visit Paris next time :) 18:53  ^^ 18:54  lol 18:54  improved a ton 18:54  just now I have [value1, Libre, ] instead of just : value1 18:54  but I think I can manage with this column thing .. 18:55  it's being late and you want to go back to home I think 18:55  you already helped me a ton 18:55  so .. thank you very much :) 18:55  ah, there is a getValue()  missign too 18:56  at least I am consistent in my mistakes :D 18:56  after the get($listitem) ? 18:56  you know, where I forgot it the last time ... yes, there! 18:57  ah awesome 18:57  last step will be to undertand what is this new "Space.DocWith\_XWiki.TranslationDocumentClass\_Object.Empty " but that will be for tomorrow 18:57  has quit 19:01  good evening all thank you again 19:03  ok, see you :) 19:10  has joined #xwiki 19:15  has left #xwiki 19:26  has quit 19:36  has quit 19:42  has joined #xwiki 19:49  has quit 19:55  has quit 20:04  has joined #xwiki 20:13  has quit 20:16  has joined #xwiki 20:20  has quit 20:21  has joined #xwiki 20:23  has joined #xwiki 20:26  has quit 20:28  has joined #xwiki 20:28  has quit 20:28  has quit 20:28  has joined #xwiki 21:41  has quit 21:56  has quit 21:58  has quit 21:59  has joined #xwiki 22:17  has joined #xwiki 22:32  has quit 23:14  has quit 23:47  has quit
